articles.title: Child–mother attachment in toddlerhood moderates adolescents’ evaluation of trustworthiness - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: Interpersonal trust is a crucial component of healthy relationships. When we interact with strangers, we quickly gauge whether we can trust them. And those important social skills may be shaped by our earliest relationship with caregivers.
